Articles.Content:
The challenge is simple but quite tricky, land on the dark side of the mun and return back to kerbin. It may sound easy but it is harder than it looks (or i am just a noob at ksp).

The rules are as follows:

1. no mods allowed

2. no lights allowed

3. screenshot proof of doing so. (one of your craft on the dark side of the mun and one back at kerbin)

4. it should be complete nightime. No flicker of sun over the horizon.

word of warning: when i tried it i got paranoid of where the ground was so i burnt excessive fuel so even if i had managed to land it (i panicked and crashed) i would not of had enough fuel to get back home. Keep your cool.

have i go at it and put me to shame.

Solution(s):

- use the radar altimeter in IVA view

- land an ummanned probe first to know how high the terrain is in the chosen landing area, the land the main ship

- slap "sepratron unguided rockets" pointing downward on the lander, and shoot them as you approach the ground to see how far it is
Just land using the view from inside the cockpit. Simple.
